page.title: 02POTTEN END-A BRIEF SUMMARY.
page.content:
POTTEN END IS A QUAINT LITTLE VILLAGE ON THE OUTSKIRTS OF HEMEL HEMPSTEAD. IT IS MADE UP OF MAINLY FARMLAND AND WOODLAND. POTTEN END HAS FEW LARGE RESIDENTIAL AREAS AND DETACHED HOUSING PREDOMINATES. SOME COTTAGES HAVE THATCHED ROOFS OF REEDS WHICH HAVE TO BE REPLACED EVERY THIRTY YEARS.
POTTEN HAS ONLY ONE PRIMARY SCHOOL WHICH ACCEPTS CHILDREN FROM 5 TO 11 YEARS.POTTEN END ALSO HAS A PLAY AREA SET ASIDE FOR THE CHILDREN TO USE.
THERE ARE MANY FARMS WITHIN THE POTTEN END AREA THAT COVER A LARGE NUMBER OF FIELDS,AND POSESS THEIR OWN LIVESTOCK. THE PLOUGHING AND HARVESTING OF THE FIELDS IS DONE BY MECHANISED MACHINES SUCH AS TRACTORS AND COMBINE HARVESTERS. OVERALL POTTEN END IS A VERY PLEASENT VILLAGE.
